content.text:
# 1994 Minnesota Vikings season

The 1994 season was the Minnesota Vikings' 34th in the National Football League (NFL) and their third under head coach Dennis Green. The team finished with a 10–6 record and reached the playoffs for a third straight season, but also failed to make it out of the wild-card round for the third year in a row, losing 35–18 to their division rival Chicago Bears.

First quarter
*TB – Errict Rhett 1-yard run (Michael Husted kick), 11:14. Buccaneers 7–0. Drive: 3 plays, 6 yards, 1:26.
Second quarter
*MIN – Fuad Reveiz 23-yard field goal, 13:36. Buccaneers 7–3. Drive: 12 plays, 61 yards, 6:10.
*MIN – Fuad Reveiz 21-yard field goal, 8:16. Buccaneers 7–6. Drive: 9 plays, 49 yards, 2:58.
*TB – Courtney Hawkins 14-yard pass from Craig Erickson (Michael Husted kick), 5:13. Buccaneers 14–6. Drive: 8 plays, 55 yards, 3:03.
*MIN – Fuad Reveiz 51-yard field goal, 0:33. Buccaneers 14–9. Drive: 10 plays, 53 yards, 2:41.
Third quarter
*No scoring plays.
Fourth quarter
*TB – Michael Husted 27-yard field goal, 5:24. Buccaneers 17–9. Drive: 14 plays, 86 yards, 7:58.
*MIN – Qadry Ismail 40-yard pass from Warren Moon (Warren Moon–Cris Carter pass), 1:27. Tied 17–17. Drive: 3 plays, 52 yards, 0:31.
Overtime
*TB – Michael Husted 22-yard field goal, 12:52. Buccaneers 20–17. Drive: 6 plays, 58 yards, 2:08.

|scoring=
First quarter
*MIN – Fuad Reveiz 29-yard field goal, 8:01. Vikings 3–0. 4 plays, −6 yards, 1:20.
Second quarter
*CHI – Lewis Tillman 1-yard run (Kevin Butler kick), 11:46. Bears 7–3. Drive: 16 plays, 80 yards, 8:51.
*CHI – Keith Jennings 9-yard pass from Steve Walsh (Kevin Butler kick), 8:03. Bears 14–3. Drive: 4 plays, 71 yards, 2:02.
*MIN – Cris Carter 4-yard pass from Warren Moon (pass failed), 0:19. Bears 14–9. Drive: 6 plays, 47 yards, 1:26.
Third quarter
*CHI – Raymont Harris 29-yard run (Kevin Butler kick), 12:57. Bears 21–9. Drive: 4 plays, 75 yards, 2:03.
*MIN – Fuad Reveiz 48-yard field goal, 0:05. Bears 21–12. Drive: 6 plays, 37 yards, 0:54.
Fourth quarter
*CHI – Jeff Graham 21-yard pass from Steve Walsh (Kevin Butler kick), 12:42. Bears 28–12. Drive: 6 plays, 60 yards, 2:23.
*MIN – Amp Lee 11-yard pass from Warren Moon (pass failed), 5:36. Bears 28–18. Drive: 16 plays, 76 yards, 7:06.
*CHI – Kevin Miniefield 48-yard fumble return (Kevin Butler kick), 3:05. Bears 35–18.
|stats=
Top passers
*CHI – Steve Walsh – 15/23, 221 yards, 2 TD, INT
*MIN – Warren Moon – 29/52, 292 yards, 2 TD, 2 INT
Top rushers
*CHI – Raymont Harris – 13 rushes, 67 yards, TD
*MIN – Terry Allen – 12 rushes, 27 yards
Top receivers
*CHI – Jeff Graham – 4 receptions, 108 yards, TD
*MIN – Amp Lee – 11 receptions, 159 yards, TD
}}
The Bears picked off Warren Moon twice while Steve Walsh threw two touchdowns, backs Raymont Harris and Lewis Tillman added rushing scores, and Kevin Miniefield ran back a Vikings fumble for a touchdown.

Awards and honors
* Cris Carter, Led NFL in receptions
* Cris Carter, All-Pro selection
* Cris Carter, Pro Bowl selection
* Warren Moon, Pro Bowl selection 1994
* Warren Moon, NFL leader, passing yards, (4,264)
Milestones
* Cris Carter, 100 reception season (Carter finished the season with 122 receptions)
* Warren Moon, 3rd 4,000-yard passing season
* Warren Moon, 5th 400-yard passing game (November 6)
* Warren Moon, 6th 400-yard passing game (November 20)
